name: Pozole Rojo (Mexican Pork and Hominy Stew)
author: Consuelo Aguilar
summary: The traditional Mexican dish in the red version: pork and hominy in a thick broth colored and flavored with guajillo chiles. Serve with tortilla chips.
ingredients: 4 ounces dried guajillo chiles, stemmed and seeded
directions: Place hominy in a large pot; cover with water
Add 1 head garlic and salt to taste
Cook over medium heat for 2 hours
Place pork shoulder, pork loin, and pork neck bones in the hominy mixture and cook until meat is tender and cooked through, about 1 hour
Place tomato and guajillo chiles in a pot and add enough water to cover; bring to a boil
Cook until chiles have softened, 15 to 20 minutes
Place tomato and chiles with salt, 1 clove garlic, oregano, and cumin in a blender; add 2 cups water
Strain mixture through a fine-mesh sieve and set chile sauce aside
Transfer pork to a work surface and shred with 2 forks
Pour chile sauce into hominy mixture; bring to a boil
Simmer pozole until flavors have blended, about 3 minutes
Ladle pozole into serving bowls and top with lettuce and onion and serve lime wedge on the side
